title: Apple Stock Doesn’t Do Well in September and October. One Analyst Says Buy It Anyway.
text:
Apple stock has roared back from a rough second half last year to record highs in 2019. Though September and October have historically been the worst times to buy the stock, an analyst at UBS sees more gains to come.

The back story. Apple stock (ticker: AAPL) is up 54% in 2019, and nearly 11% in the trailing one-year period. It has far outpaced the S&P 500 index so far this year, though it has lagged behind the benchmark index’s gains by about half a percentage point in the past 12 months.

...
description: Apple stock has roared back from a rough second half last year to record highs in 2019. There are reasons to be optimistic about iPhone 11 sales UBS says.
